intro: Erucastrum virgatum var. pseudosinapis, commonly known as the false rapeseed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with upright stems and small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are alternate, lobed, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The species is characterized by its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
